snippet: Questions persist after the release of a newly declassified version of a legal memo approving a set of warrantless surveillance and data collection activities secretly authorized after 9/11.
abstract: Justice Department releases less-redacted version of May 2004 legal memo approving National Security Agency’s Stellarwind program, set of warrantless surveillance and data collection activities that Pres George W Bush secretly authorized after September 11 terrorist attacks; newly declassified memo still leaves questions unanswered regarding collection of Americans' phone and email records.
lead_paragraph: Questions persist after the release of a newly declassified version of a legal memo approving a set of warrantless surveillance and data collection activities secretly authorized after 9/11.

headline.main: Redactions in U.S. Memo Leave Doubts on Data Surveillance Program
headline.print_headline: Redactions in U.S. Memo Leave Doubts on Data Plan
